      • possibleAttacks

        public java.util.Vector<Position> possibleAttacks(Position currentPosition,
                                                  Board board,
                                                  Piece.Team currentTeam)
        Compute all the cells where the selected piece can attack. Return a vector of Position.
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - Position of the current piece
        board - The board containing our position
        currentTeam - the team that is moving
        Returns:
        A vector containing the allowed positions to which the piece in currentPosition can attacks
        Throws:
        throw - IllegalArgumentException if the selected piece cannot attack

      • isPermitted

        public boolean isPermitted(Position pos,
                           Board board,
                           Piece.Team currentTeam)
        Method used by PossibleDirectionsRecursive and PossibleDirectionsRecursiveFly. It checks if the candidate position is inside the board or if it is occuped by an ally
        Parameters:
        pos - Position to test
        board - The board containing our position
        currentTeam - The team that is moving
        Returns:
        False if the position is outside the board or if there is a piece of the current team

      • isOutOfBoard

        public boolean isOutOfBoard(Position pos,
                            Board board)
        Method used by possibleDirectionsRecursiveFly. It just checks if the candidate position is inside the board.
        Parameters:
        pos -
        board -
        Returns:
        true if the piece is out of the board, false if it is inside

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength()

      • possibleDirectionsRecursiveWalk

        public void possibleDirectionsRecursiveWalk(Position initialPosition,
                                            Board board,
                                            Piece.Team currentTeam,
                                            java.util.Vector<Position> allowedPosition,
                                            int range,
                                            int[][] checkElements)
        Method that compute all the possible directions of a type walk piece selected by the user
        Parameters:
        initialPosition - The position of the piece that will call the method
        board - The board containing our positions
        currentTeam - The team which has the turn
        allowedPosition - The vector contains the allowed positions. It will be passed from the method possibleDirections that will return it after the computation
        range - At the first call of the method is equal to the range of the Piece that call the function. Then it is decresead of one unit to call the recursive calls.
        checkElements - Vector used to avoid the same copy of the element in allowedPosition. This is possible because of the recursive approach.

      • possibleDirectionsRecursiveFly

        public void possibleDirectionsRecursiveFly(Position initialPosition,
                                           Board board,
                                           Piece.Team currentTeam,
                                           java.util.Vector<Position> allowedPosition,
                                           int range,
                                           int[][] checkElements)
        Method that compute all the possible directions of a type fly piece selected by the user
        Parameters:
        initialPosition - The position of the piece that will call the method
        board - The board containing our positions
        currentTeam - The team which has the turn
        allowedPosition - The vector contains the allowed positions. It will be passed from the method possibleDirections that will return it after the computation
        range - At the first call of the method is equal to the range of the Piece that call the function. Then it is decresead of one unit to call the recursive calls.
        checkElements - Vector used to avoid the same copy of the element in allowedPosition. This is possible because of the recursive approach.

      • possibleDirections

        public java.util.Vector<Position> possibleDirections(Position initialPosition,
                                                     Board board,
                                                     Piece.Team currentTeam)
        Method that computes a possible directions vector of the piece selected by the user. It calls possibleDirectionRecursiveWalk or possibleDirectionsFly based on the selected piece's move type
        Parameters:
        initialPosition - Position of the piece selected by the user
        board - Current board setting
        currentTeam - Team of the piece in currentPosition
        Returns:
        A vector filled with the allowed positions
